reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed in a lot of hotels in Manhattan and wouldn‚Äôt return here. The location is great and the Blue Bottle in the lobby was lovely to have. Check in was a mess, service throughout our stay was not great, and room keys worked only intermittently. We stayed in one of the larger king rooms and it was still the smallest NYC room I‚Äôve ever stayed in, almost comically so. It‚Äôs not a bad hotel but for the price you can do much better, even in Manhattan.

There were a few surprises with this hotel, both good and bad. First, there‚Äôs a hidden facility fee that wasn‚Äôt clear when I booked‚Äîit‚Äôs calculated daily and is quite a high percentage, so the final price is not what you initially see.

The rooms are small, which is typical in NYC, but even so, I was surprised by Walker Hotel‚Äôs layout. The interior design isn‚Äôt very functional, with a large single sofa taking up a lot of space. The sofa isn‚Äôt particularly comfortable either, and moving it is a hassle‚Äîthe heavy backrest can easily pinch your fingers. I had a painful experience with it, and what really touched me was my 1.5-year-old trying to ‚Äúscold‚Äù the sofa for hurting me! My heart melted, but be cautious and don‚Äôt let kids play around with it‚Äîit‚Äôs very easy to get injured. The room is so tiny that even turning around is difficult.

Ultimately, you‚Äôll probably just stay on the bed, which isn‚Äôt a problem if all you need is a place to sleep. After all, the hotel‚Äôs location is excellent‚Äîperfect for exploring NYC, not staying in the room.

The hotel isn‚Äôt very stroller-friendly either. The check-in desk is on the basement level, and from the first floor, you have to take the stairs up with your luggage and stroller before heading downstairs again to check in. There‚Äôs a man at the entrance wearing a flashy outfit, but all he does is point you to the stairs and then downstairs‚Äîhe won‚Äôt actually help you with your bags. It‚Äôs just how some New Yorkers are: indifferent and cool.

On the bright side, the coffee shop on the first floor is quite nice, and I had a pleasant experience there.

Overall, while the staff could be more helpful and the rooms are not the most practical, the location and the caf√© downstairs do add some redeeming qualities. Just be prepared for a bit of inconvenience if you‚Äôre traveling with kids or have a lot of luggage.

Good location, nice staff and ambiance.

But facilities and furniture needs to be improved.

Walls are full of random uneven paints. Table chips. Sink chips. Set up of the bathroom is weird too but not that big of the deal in this. Lights are missing randomly. TV is not working well. Walls are also not soundproof, might lead to sleep difficulties.

Staffs are very welcoming and helpful. I hope you guys can review this issue and improve

Location was fine and the room was clean. Service at the front desk was extraordinarily, above-and-beyond helpful, with everything from AC to check-in. However, the rooms are so small that they're barely habitable‚Äîthe bed was so small that my husband and I didn't fit together on it, and my legs stuck out over the edge. There was no place to charge our phones. It was a really depressing evening overall.

I could not have asked for a better experience at this hotel! From the moment we walked in, the staff was friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a king suite and received free drink vouchers. While we were only staying one night, we got to check out the rooftop bar with amazing views, drinks, and food. The staff there was incredible as well. I could not believe how nice of a hotel this was for the price. The room was perfect for two people and very clean. I will not stay anywhere else when I return to NYC! I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in this area.

Great location and staff are very helpful. The room was mostly clean but some corners had dust buildup and/or weren‚Äôt wiped properly. Some parts of the room a bit tired and in need of TLC. Rooms are very small - but that‚Äôs manhattan for you. Overall would recommend for a place to sleep and a nice vibe from the hotel if you don‚Äôt need much else!

The staff here are incredibly friendly and go out of their way to make sure you feel welcome! It was our first time here, and our room was upgraded and the manager gave us two free drinks as well. The rooms were exactly as pictured and very clean. Perfect for two people. Location was great as well. Would definitely stay here again!

Came here for a one night stay and it was such a lovely experience. Bridgette and all the other staff members we engaged with were so nice. The location is in great spot and you have two bars, a restaurant, and two coffee/pastries options to choose from at the hotel. The rooms are on the smaller side- but it‚Äôs exactly how it is portrayed online. They were perfect for two people and very modern and clean! We had a drink at the rooftop bar as well as the speakeasy downstairs and both were delish! Couldn‚Äôt recommend this spot more and I will continue to go back here if I‚Äôm ever in NYC again. The staff and the amenities were A++!

Stay at the hotel last week and the service was excellent. Shauna at the front the desk was super helpful and very welcoming. The rooms were great too, wish they were a tad bit bigger but definitely fine for my length of stay. Would highly recommend this place.

ADDITION:
Checked out of the hotel - no charges mentioned at the desk - come to find out there were facility charges that the checkout didn't let me know about. Called and got the receipt emailed to me but this is hotel admin 101! I shouldn't have needed to call for anything past my stay!

ALSO I emailed the hotel to ask what would my next stay would look like (based on their speedy response to my last post) NO RESPONSE.. it's nice and all that you have someone checking Google Reviews to appease unhappy clients, but don't play your customers for fools - if you're going to offer to make something right, then do it.

OLD REVIEW:
Don‚Äôt know how hotels like this get away with the shoe box sized rooms and the insane cost per night. I‚Äôm a native NYer come back here for work regularly and have stayed at many boutique hotels. This is by far the worst for its cost. The room is a literal closet, Lumpy pillows (seriously?? How hard is that to get right?), even though it‚Äôs small they have made it worse through their design choices. You lose space because of the massive garbage cans (there are two; 1 for recyclables - why aren‚Äôt these smaller where they could fit under the sink? Or beside the toilet?)
People say you pay for location but honestly, if you‚Äôre staying in Manhattan ANYWHERE is close to ANYTHING! There is no need for this small a room. And then the WiFi (!!!) can‚Äôt open a single website on this WiFi. COME ON. Terrible.

Oh had to come back to add MOTHS!! There are moths in my room‚Ä¶üôÑüò©ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

Another addition. Staff I‚Äôm sure is generally good, I didn‚Äôt have a specifically notable experience except I had a friend coming to meet me and asked to leave a key at the desk which they said they couldn‚Äôt do but said they‚Äôd add him to the reservation and he‚Äôd just need to show ID to get the key but later that evening I got a call from my friend saying I needed to call the front desk because they wouldn‚Äôt give him a key. The person at the front desk said that I needed to add my friend to the reservation and I explained that I had at check in but somehow that wasn‚Äôt done. It‚Äôs not a big deal but that‚Äôs why my staff review isn‚Äôt higher. Other than that folks are friendly. Haven‚Äôt needed them for anything else.

Stayed here for a long weekend with a friend. It was a lovely hotel with character and charm. Loved the on-site restaurant, coffee shop, lounge and rooftop. Staff were always friendly. Good location. Would definitely recommend.

I‚Äôve stayed here many times over the years and I love it. Perfect location for my interests, comfy rooms, and great staff. In particular, Nelson is always ready to help with my bags, storing items before and after checkout, and offering water and umbrellas when needed. He‚Äôs such a cheerful and positive presence and a great representation of the rest of the Walker staff!

I was impressed with the check-in with their friendly but professional personality. They explained how use your room car to use to go up to your or roof top. They gave a map of  how locate the numerous art galleries nearby The check -in staff told of what services were available.

Location and service were fine. Room was awful. It was insanely small, but that was expected. No fridge, our safe was broken so we couldn‚Äôt even use that, and we couldn‚Äôt sleep at night because it sounded like the window was open (even though it wasn‚Äôt). We heard absolutely everything, including the extremely loud trucks and construction in the morning. Some noise is obviously normal and expected, but it really sounded like the window was completely open. Maybe it was broken? Who knows. Either way, I would not stay here again and would not recommend to anyone wanting to sleep at night.

Pros:
- Great location!
- Rooms are clean and nice feeling.

Cons:
- This is more like a pod hotel than other places I've stayed at, including in downtown Manhattan. Bed takes up the bulk of the room, very little room to stand.
- They stick you with one of those annoying scammy mandatory resort fees at check-out for $40 a night. This should be divulged at booking, or at the very latest, at check-in.
- The gym, while aesthetically appealing, is basically useless. Only has light weights, some strange cardio equipment, and a hard to use cable machine.

Great location. On check in, my door lock was broken and couldn‚Äôt close my door. I asked for someone to come fix it and nobody showed up within 1 hour so I tampered with the door and closed it myself. I was only visiting nyc for 2 days so I didn't want to waste my time waiting for someone to fix my door.

Figured out at 4am that the window was also broken as it was stuck open so all the construction noise from outside was entering the room.

Terrible room, mid service. Wouldn‚Äôt stay here again.

I stayed here in May 2024 and I can say I will not stay here again or recommend it to friends. The rooms are tiny, even by NYC standards, the layout of the hotel is odd, no ramp for luggage, front desk down a set of stairs, small dark elevators‚Ä¶It‚Äôs definitely overpriced for what you pay. No coffee, no mini bar, no breakfast, no fridge or microwave or room service. It feels that the priority here is the cafe and restaurant downstairs. It‚Äôs not really oriented towards the guest experience or comfort for travelers. The pluses I would say are the showers are very good, the rooms are very clean, bed comfortable, great bedding and lighting and outlets that are convenient. However, it‚Äôs overpriced and there are better valued accommodations in the city.

Went here for a solo trip into NYC for MDW. Honestly the best spot and reasonable for being in Tribeca. You are just minutes away from Chinatown and Little Italy not to mention the Brooklyn Bridge. Tons of great restaurants and the nightlife at the hotel is awesome.

The room that I got was a bit small but honestly it was fine for me as I just slept there. I spent most of my time outside.

Couple of things to mention: the rooms are not sound proof so if you're a light sleeper that might be an issue. Also there are fees that are additionally paid at the hotel. The bed was arranged looking out the window. It didn't look like the window was darkened on the outside so people could look in so I kept it shut.

Great find will be back!

I'm going to give you the good and the bad.
There are a lot of good things about the Walker Tribeca, which you will see in the pictures. The bad things, though, while few, are enough of a deal breaker that it will keep me from going back, and it's mainly the height of things. The bed's platform is so high off the ground that it needs a step ( but doesn't have one) and to get up in the middle of the night is tricky. If you want to look out the windows, you have 3 options: climb up onto the bed and walk across it, roll across it, or climb up and try to walk the narrow ledge at the end of the bed, which can pretty much only be done by a gymnast on a balance beam. And to get up in the middle of the night when there are two of you and you are the person on the side by the window is a near-death experience. The second issue is that they positioned the handheld shower so high that even on my tiptoes, I could not reach it! And while I understand why a hotel would not put the room number on their room key (plus it's black so you wouldn't see it anyway), it is tricky when you can't easily remember your room number!
The hotel itself is beautifully appointed yet comfortable, not pretentious. EVERY SINGLE STAFF PERSON WAS NICE! They were all friendly and kind. There are multiple public spaces within the hotel:  a seating area near the cafe, an on-site restaurant, a lower area lounge by re reception area, and a beautiful  rooftop bar/cafe with amazing views. The hotel is near multiple subway lines and Canal Street, and is right around the corner from the Banksy Museum, as well as within walking distance of both Chinatown and Little Italy. I'd say if you have gymnastic skills to get onto the bed safely, then this hotel is for you.

No ramp for luggage and no one helps you get up to the front desk which I thought was odd. There are a number of steps to get inside and then you have to go downstairs to check in. The elevator and hallways are small and narrow but the rooms are TINY. There is no fridge in the room and more than one person could not stay in a room despite there being a queen size bed. The hotel was clean, centrally located, and quaint, but I wouldn't stay again because you can barely walk around the bed.
Really friendly staff everyone, great coffee and breakfast. Unique experience in their underground bar. Nice room. Good gym. Would come again! ü•∞

Both elevators were down, the whole hotel had to use the staff elevator. Incredibly slow
No coffee maker inside rooms. The ‚Äúdo not disturb‚Äù light didn‚Äôt work, so was woke by endless knocking of housekeeping every AM.
Tiny, I mean tiny rooks. Price is low but now I know why!

I recently stayed at the Walker Hotel in Tribeca and was disappointed by my experience. Despite the hotel's charming decor and convenient location, several issues significantly marred our stay.

Firstly, we were charged an extra $172.1 without any prior notification or invoice. I tried to contact the hotel via email to resolve the issue, but I received no response. The lack of communication and transparency was frustrating and unprofessional.

Secondly, the overall service during our stay was subpar. The staff seemed disinterested and were not helpful when we needed assistance. This level of service is unacceptable, especially given the additional charges we incurred.

In summary, while the Walker Hotel in Tribeca has potential, the poor communication and service we experienced overshadowed the positive aspects of our stay. I hope the management addresses these issues to prevent future guests from having a similar experience.

I visit the city on a monthly basis and this is the ONLY place I would ever stay in NYC. It is honestly a second home for me. From beginning to end, the Walker Tribeca offers you a flawless stay. Perfect location. Best area. The bars and restaurants in this hotel are perfect - shoutout to Francisco &Collin at Saint Tuesdays and Pablo & Cesar at the Walker Rooftop Bar! At the front desk, everyone is super friendly, welcoming & helpful - a special thank you to Nelson, Randon & Edwin!

The best hotel in the city.

Room 219 is extremely noisy --- DO NOT STAY. If you stay, make sure you stay on a higher floor and/or not on the same corner as 219.

There was noise from both inside and outside of the building.

Noise from outside of the building: the sound of trucks backing up, loading, and unloading is non-stop throughout the night. The sound of people chatting, laughing, yelling, and shouting right outside of the building was also constant. For a room this close to the street, this hotel should really invest in soundproofing windows.

Noise from inside of the building: the room is right next to the service elevator. The noise of maybe boxes or trolleys being moved is not as constant, but it's disturbing, adding on top of the noise from outside.

I couldn't sleep both nights when I was there. I would warn anyone who's staying to be aware of the room the hotel staff assign you to stay.

My daughter and I had a great time at the Walker. Yes, rooms are small but that is what is expected in TriBeCa/soho and from a fun boutique hotel.  We booked through NYU and thought we were getting a deal but looks like we overpaid a bit-my only regret there but we had a great stay and love the space.

Very beautiful hotel, except the size of the room my wife and I rented for just a few hours was very small and very expensive for us, charged us $354.00.They didn't offer a bereavement fare nor a complimentary breakfast. None of our money back when we checked in around 4 AM Wed morning and checked out before the 10 AM check out time..

We are very happy to have booked this hotel. It has a convenient location near the Canal St. Metro station and SoHo. Lots of different breakfast, lunch and dinner options within walking distance.

The hotel appears very modern and luxurious. Downside is that the entrance from the street does not accommodate large suitcases, since you immediately stumble upon stairs. Reception of the hotel is also on the Lower Level. Check in was quick and without any hassle. Note that $500 deposit is required (via creditcard).

The rooms are not big, but we stayed here for five nights and had enough room to store everything. It's a modern room with a lot of smart buttons for the lighting and blinds. Air Conditioning is also very good, just as the smart tv. Casting your phone actually worked in our room. WiFi is also pretty fine! We do missed a mini fridge and our safe did not work. Even after asking the reception twice to fix it. There were even more minor observations that made me decide to give the review four stars instead of five. The bedframe (or how you can describe it), was broken and made noise when moving. One shelf in the closet had also fallen down and nobody seemed to have fixed it.

Altogether we were happy to have chosen this hotel as the bed was comfortable and the location of the hotel was great.

The Walker Hotel Tribeca is a hidden gem in the heart of New York City, offering an unparalleled boutique experience. From the moment you step into the stylish lobby, you're greeted by a warm and welcoming ambiance that perfectly blends modern sophistication with historic charm.

One of the standout features of the Walker Hotel Tribeca is its exceptional service. The staff is incredibly attentive, friendly, and eager to assist with any needs or requests. Whether you're looking for dining recommendations, directions to nearby attractions, or simply a friendly chat, the team goes above and beyond to make you feel at home.

Overall, the Walker Hotel Tribeca is an exceptional choice for travelers seeking a unique and memorable stay in New York City. With its stylish design, top-notch service, and unbeatable location, it truly stands out as one of the city's finest boutique hotels.

I was traveling with family and friends, and coordinated the group to stay at the hotel, with three reservations. The night prior to arriving in NYC, I called to see if we could have access to one room to drop our luggage and freshen up from the flights. The person over the phone said just to show up and there will be an option available. I would've preferred some assurance, or a plan to avoid the convo again when checking in. When we arrived, sure enough I had to give the whole spiel, and was told that they didn't say that, and they meant I could store them in a closet. I've been to many hotels and understand what's available and how it works. Anyways, we got a room after my lecture. The room had a pubic hair on the pillow, a large dip in the ground upon entry, the door threshold cracked had to SLAM the door to close it, toothpaste or something on the bathroom light switch. Just not comfortable and not what a room should be like. I figured I would just accept it and after the AC not working that night, knew I couldn't spend more nights there. The night desk agent was helpful and switched my room, and when going into that one, there was another pubic hair and stains on the vanity counter, in addition to the issues of leaking showers. There are definitely structural issues and water issues happening in these rooms.

One night, I was walking to show my sister Saint Tuesday. The young male host attendant  spoke to me so nasty and sarcastic, I was embarrassed and angry about it. I chose to accept it, but now wish I would have given it back to him. Completely unprofessional, rude, and uncalled for. I think he forgot who the host was and who the guest was. When I told the same night agent, she apologized and offered a late check out. Why the hell would I want to stay in this place longer? Not an acceptable resolution. Very disappointed and will never stay again, despite many trips each year to the city. The pictures definitely paint a different experience.

The rooms are so absurdly tiny it‚Äôs kinda funny. Especially for the price. King bed is up against three walls so you can only access it from one side. Terrible sound proofing from the street and inside. You can easily hear other people‚Äôs conversations and when they use the bathroom, which is also very tiny.

Nicely decorated though. And the bed was comfortable. The staff were great and my room was serviced every day.

I checked in and have been asked for a caution of 500 USD (to be frozen on the credit card) to cover eventual damage, or for expenditure I will have like drinks. As I checked out, they told me I have around 70 USD costs for some stuff I ate, and 55 USD for Internet costs (already strange). I accepted and paid, asked for a detailed invoice list per email. As I was gone and received the email, suddenly the costs were of 457 USD and taken from my credit card. As I asked explanation they told me, it is for the daily use of internet (I just slept in that hotel).  Beside the craziness of the amount, and the dishonest way it has been charged on my credit card, I showed them on my reservation that in any case all supplementaries  and taxes were paid with the booking.  They didn‚Äôt care, I had to fly back home and never saw my money again.
rooms are small for NY and poorly maintained. hotel is not actually in tribeca. there are so many better hotels, I don't know why anyone would ever willingly stay here

Pros: The rooms are well designed with a comfortable bed and nice sheets. Shower is great and the auto blinds are clutch. The location is also really great and I love how there‚Äôs a coffee shop downstairs.

Cons: The rooms are very small, which means you‚Äôll lack basic amenities like a kettle or coffee maker. You can request them, but it may not be in stock and‚Ä¶ this is all assuming they remember your request. 80% of the time my requests go into a void and I would have to follow up repeatedly and they may not get back to me until a day or two later. I simply cannot trust the staff when they say they will handle something or call me later with an update.

The cleaning staff here also don‚Äôt really clean, they‚Äôll change towels and sheets, but won‚Äôt sweep up the floors or even wipe the surface. Restocking stuff like tissues is also a problem‚Ä¶ For a 4 star hotel and the price, I would‚Äôve expected better service in both the staff and cleaning.

Lastly‚Ä¶ the gym is OK. It‚Äôs aesthetically pleasing, but not really functional.

The room was the size of a closet, no space to put anything or even walk. Extremely cramped. Only had access to the bed from one side. The view is of another building across the street. The location was more of Chinatown than TriBeCa. It‚Äôs located right off Canal St in Chinatown. Shower was so tiny, good luck if you‚Äôre over 6 feet, or if you‚Äôre heavier than the average person. A lot of bumping into things! Bumping into the bed, bumping into the sink, bumping into the toilet,etc. Just way too tiny for $250/night. Not a reasonable price. Also tacked on some fees. For one single night they held $450 on my credit card. That included the $125/day refundable fee. The staff were great, the hotel was clean. But it was just way too cramped & overpriced for me & my guest. Wouldn‚Äôt stay here again or recommend if you want room to breathe.

I was invited here on a sex date. The rooms are small but smart; the closeness of the walls and furniture provide lots of sturdy push-off points for different positions and angles. Staff made me feel welcome and unashamed as I left early. The croissant stand loved hearing me sing the rooms praises. Their croissant and coffee are exceptional and very different. I've been back since just for these, and plan to meet my date there again in 24.

Staff is amazing it‚Äôs always a pleasure staying here they definitely go above and beyond to accommodate you best staff ever  I also love how clean the rooms are would recommend this hotel to everyone

we booked the trip far in advance and paid all needed fees when we arrived they placed a $400 hold on our credit card for ‚Äúincidentals‚Äù. after we left we were charged $107 for wifi(on the website it said free), water, gym, and 20% off the restaurant we did not even go to. the hotel rooms are very small and cramped as well. very noisy outside we could not even sleep at night

Last minute booking for one night - staff was all very helpful, especially Nelson. Kind and willing to help out. I requested a couple things for the room and the service was quick and got what we needed right away.  The room is small but I actually loved it.  It felt super cozy. There were 2 of us (my daughter and me) so might not be an ideal set up for others.  The location is great if you‚Äôre wanting to stay downtown.  The gym was small, but clean and had what I needed.  We didn‚Äôt get to enjoy the public spaces or coffee shop /restaurant bc it was such a short stay, but looked great.  Will definitely book again if staying downtown!

Had an amazing time at the Walker Tribeca. The location was incredible and in the heart of everything we wanted to do. The staff were responsive, kind and helpful. Our room had the most beautiful view of the entire downtown. We loved the blue bottle coffee, the Mostrador cafe coffee and had such a great time at Saint Tuesday‚Äôs. Would recommend to anyone looking to stay in Manhattan. Everything you could want is within a 10-minute walking distance - shopping, food, cute cafes and entertainment!

This hotel needs a serious tune up- both in service as well as condition of the rooms.
There is no real lobby - the entrance leads to a restaurant check in and a shared space with Blue Bottle coffee. The shared space is nice looking. l have no idea if it is filled with hotel guests or blue bottle customers. There is no drinks service in the lobby and both the roof bar and restaurant bar are closed several days a week. The whole place feels like some rooms above a whole bunch of leased spaces for other businesses.

Biggest issues for me is there is no one to greet you at the entrance, the ‚Äúlobby‚Äù is in a sub-basement. Getting in or out of a car with packages is a juggle on a busy street up and down several flights of stairs with no help.

The service is seriously disappointing. Its earnest but utterly hapless, I get the feel that most people have never worked in hospitality before. They have no idea what to say or do when confronted with something as simple as a package delivery or pickup- this is not a business hotel at all.

The base rooms are very tiny, I was staying in the corner which is somewhat more spacious. But the surfaces are seriously worn- cigarette holes in upholstery, very visible peeling paint etc.

If you are looking for prime location and a place to sleep this might be a good fit, if you are looking for a ‚Äúhotel‚Äù with a modicum of service and pleasure look elsewhere.

I‚Äôm giving 4 stars because the room was so tiny it didn‚Äôt make me mad but rather laugh. Staff is great and there is an amazing speakeasy. Bed was comfortable. Be aware that my partner and I couldn‚Äôt both leisurely hang AT ALL in the room, but that‚Äôs okay. We weren‚Äôt here to stay and lounge in our hotel room. It was solely to sleep and shower ‚Äî that‚Äôs it.

The hotel is between Soho and Tribeca, near the Canal subway station. Edwin and Nelson at the front desk are outstanding in being efficient, friendly, helpful, and polite; they speak English and Spanish. The rooms are according to the concept of the hotel, of course. Very functional and well illuminated, despite being small; impeccable cleanliness. They have a cafe with great bread and espresso, a small restaurant with good breakfasts, and a Blue Bottle cafe within the complex. I would recommend this hotel without hesitation for couples who are going to the theater or walking for a few days in NYC.
Nice hotel in a great location - downtown Manhattan. They serve the best coffee in the coffee shop in the lobby. I recommend.

What a great location for a hotel! Would highly recommend to friends and family visiting from out of town or even just for a staycation. Cozy, functional room with incredible views and access to top-notch food and activities. The staff were always so helpful and generous with their time. Special shout out to the security guard, who always went above and beyond! Loved the entertainment at Saint Tuesdays and it was perfect being able to just go downstairs for dinner, and then for drinks. With Au Cheval next door, the location couldn‚Äôt be better. Would definitely come back!
It was perfect! Big thanks to Nelson from the hotel staff, he was really helpful.

Smallest hotel room I‚Äôve ever experienced. Surprise ‚Äúfacilities fee‚Äù gets charged without any warning - $35 per day. Wish we booked somewhere else for the price it ended up coming to. Don‚Äôt be fooled by the nice photos. It‚Äôs claustrophobic and better off looking elsewhere
the room was tiny, had no coffee station! but the location and the service were amazing... check the bars at the hotel and they are awesome...

I Really don‚Äôt know where to start should I start off with the guest service from host who didn‚Äôt acknowledge us not even once then when ask a question about parking or anything else around there no answer but that‚Äôs not my concern my main concern was I had a guest who was with me took a shower when I went in behind them shower was stopped up it really freaked me out that someone else dirt touch my feet in the shower water filled up then same thing with the sink which is outside of the bathroom the sink was stopped up as well so I couldn‚Äôt brush my teeth for a while waiting for water to go down then went to sleep after being tired but whole time the smell of the pillows stink so bad I don‚Äôt know if it‚Äôs breath smell from others but I do know the hotel needs work done in room and a thorough cleaning new pillows very unpleasant stay on top of rooms being so tiny you can barely move in them not worth the money at all.

the photos online are cute and charming, but the rooms themselves are comically small, claustrophobic, and poorly designed. especially for the price, i was surprised to see an entire shelf missing under the bed, veneer peeling, holes in the walls and tiles, the tv and other hangings off center and hanging weirdly, and the toilet paper holder falling off the wall. I also booked directly through the hotel website and paid for parking and late check-out but they had no record of it until searching for 20 min. after double checking that we had the room until 2 pm and paying for the late check-out, we were locked out of the room anyway. would recommend a different hotel or airbnb!

This review is for Nelson, the nicest porter who helped me get my super heavy bags down a few stairs and into my uber. Uber driver didn‚Äôt lift a finger so Nelson helped me hoist the bags in the trunk. Very knightly and kind of him!

For half the price of a normal NYC room you get what you pay for, 1/3 of a room. I ended up in one of their smaller rooms basically a walk in closet, it didn‚Äôt even have a chair. The open space in the room was 5 x 5 foot, standing room only. The bed was comfortable but raised off the floor so high it wasn‚Äôt a spot to sit, plus the TV is behind you. A good spot for a college aged kid on a NY trip but not a place I would ever stay again. Spend $100 more and get a regular hotel room.

The hotel is at a good location, we could walk to almost everywhere, and the subway station is also very close.
The room is small, but very cozy, comfortable and clean. We had a room on the top floor and the view was breathtaking.
All the staff we have met were lovely and helpful.
The only negative thing is that the restaurant is not open every day and feels very fancy (to only have a drink at the end of the day).

Smallest room i ever had, but acceptable. I am under 5'6" and was just able to fit for the bed which was very restful and comfortable. Great location between Chinatown and Little Italy. Room was clean, shower good. Raised toilet. I was not aware of add on daily charge around 35.

Room was absurdly small, must be hard for housekeeping. Front desk offered no help in getting a taxi, we had Three suitcases and a large artwork portfolio. We dragged them out to curb while I went two blocks to retrieve a taxi. Front desk had a attitude upon checking out, kept 200 dollars of a 500 dollar ‚Äúincidental charge.
I work in Japan at a four star hotel, I will never stay at this TriBeCa snotty hotel again !!!
I grew up in this neighborhood, and sadly my neighborhood has been ruined by businesses like this hotel, horrendous example of new TriBeCa attitude.
NEVER AGAIN !!!!!
Only one person offered us help, a Spanish man( never got his name).
Remember hospitality is our business, and should be the first directive ! !!

Was part of the Bernadette Thompson nail team for another Fashion show during Fashion week on September 7, 2024. The work area was small to do nails, but everyone was professional and was about getting the job done.

Overall very comfortable hotel in a great location with some downsides. Few things to keep in mind before you book:

- Rooms can be quite loud because of street noise, if you‚Äôre a light sleeper pack earplugs
- WiFi is unfortunately very slow, it‚Äôs almost impossible to work from the hotel, I would expect fast & free internet in a 4-star hotel
- Rooms are on the small side with no possibility to store luggage, as a result it can become crammed if you have a larger suitcase
- Gym is basic, more of a ‚Äûbasement fitness room‚Äú, only light weights
- They charge a facility fee of $34 per night for water and wifi on top which you have to pay separately in the hotel, if you travel for business it‚Äôs an additional hassle to expense this

Great location & lovely hotel however, we found the corner room noisy. Baring in the mind it‚Äôs NYC, there is traffic (we get it) however there appears to be little sound proofing in the windows (compared to another hotel we stayed at in Times sq at the start of our trip)

That being said, the rooms are elegant & very comfortable. We had a great sleep (using ear plugs) and the linens are super soft.
The Bluebottle coffee in the lobby is a great addition.
Water pressure in the shower / loo is a little on the low side but again, I assume it‚Äôs an older building & this isn‚Äôt a huge issue, just flush twice ;)

The bellman was great when we left, helping us store & move our luggage.

The rooms are on the smaller side but I enjoy a queen size bed and still felt like I had room to walk back and forth to the restroom. The view and location is what I enjoyed most. Plenty of places to walk to for coffee and it‚Äôs so conveniently located. But above all meeting Nelson, was the highlight of my stay. He is truly a beacon of joy and kindness. I‚Äôm disabled and I felt so seen, considered and cared for every time I interacted with him during my stay. He went above and beyond. I will be returning because of him and the location.

This was a great stay. We walked in and wend down the stairs where I felt as if I was entering a speak-easy. It was not but the beautiful wood work in the ceiling was cool.

Our room overlooked a real janky sweatshop looking thing (I loved it). The rooftop views with ‚Äúcolorful letters‚Äù made the room special.

Will definitely return!

Location:
Perfect location for getting around the city. I spent a lot of time in Tribeca which ended up being my favorite part. The hotel is also on a low traffic street so it was easy to get a nights rest.

Staff:
The hotel is clean and staff is friendly and welcoming.

Rooms:
Smaller than expected but was perfect for me as I was solo traveling. Not big enough however to fully open my checked bag in the room so I unpacked everything and put my luggage zipped up in a corner.

This place is always very clean with friendly staff! We arrived early and not only did the receptionist accommodate us on a really busy graduation weekend, they gave us a handicap accessible room without us asking because they noticed my partner was using a visual cane. Also, amenities like room shades that are automatic and multiple areas where lights can be accessed really helped my partner manage getting around with more ease. I am so grateful to this hotel and its staff for being so kind, caring, and accessible!

The room was compact for a king but well designed - staying on my own for three nights I found it secure, comfortable and clean. I booked directly via the hotel website which offered breakfast and 2pm checkout as part of the room rate. The breakfast is a coffee and non-savoury pastry from their Uruguayan restaurant - which was delicious for lunch. The late check out caused a little hassle because my room key wasn‚Äôt working when I returned around 1:30pm to get my luggage and I had to wait for someone to let me in with a managers key. Someone also called me at 1pm to remind me I needed to check out, so I think their systems haven‚Äôt noted which rooms are late check outs. If there is a way to get luggage in and out of the building without having to navigate some stairs I never found it. But I appreciated the clean design and perks and would stay again.

i was staying there for  1 night the reception are so helpful the room are nice small but modern design i like it. the bed is agains the wall no more space not really affordable for the kind of room and there wifi soooo bad i ddnt connect it cos my data is more strong than there wifi they have 2 bottle of water free.. and i was surprise next day they charge me 35$ and i ddnt know and i call them and they say its for 20% of hotel guess to the resto and for the water and wifi i ddnt even use there resto and they charge me even there wifi sooo slow..
The rooftop bar is great. Greg views. Heated alcoves.

Awesome hotel! The AC was working perfectly, it was a really hot weekend. The room is small but perfectly set up. The lights are great and everything was clean. Staff was really helpful and nice. The lobby is shared with a really nice coffee shop, it's calm with busy worker which make it a nice ambiance. Bed was comfortable, the pillow a bit too soft for me. The Walker St was pretty busy even at night, I would maybe ask for a higher room or maybe facing the Alley.
If you have suitcase, you can put them underneath the bed, there is closed compartments. Plenty of room in the closed for your clothes etc..

i stayed here last week and was incredibly taken aback by how rude the manager Mia was. she greeted me with the nastiest look when i walked in tuesday morning and asked what her problem was and she had the nastiest reply back of just ‚Äúnothing‚Äù and kept walking with her nasty grin right to her office.

We stayed here for 4 nights during a short trip to NYC. Absolutely amazing staff, every single person we came across was so nice, couldn‚Äôt have felt more welcome, looked after and comfortable!
The location is fab, easy walking distance to both the East and Greenwich village and transport links. Great gateway also
to access lower Manhattan. Our room was on the 10th floor with stunning views of the city, compact and neat, super clean and very detail oriented, modern and stylish! The coffee bar on the ground level in the building serves very good coffee!! Highly recommend!

My recent stay with the Walker Hotel Tribeca was less than desirable. Although the staff did their best to accommodate, this was an uncomfortable experience that only allowed so much for rest. I first had to switch rooms due to features that needed updating or care. Secondly, when I did switch rooms there was a heavy odor of marijuana and an eventual alarm that persisted for much of the rest of my stay. Please see below for additional details on what I encountered during my stay. Again, while the staff was kind the night of my arrival and during the day, this seems to be issues that need better management for optimal guest experiences. Unfortunately, I'm not sure that Walker Hotels will be a first choice for me again.
I would not book this hotel again. Rooms like shoeboxes, limited service. Location is okay but canal street is not the nicest area in my opinion.

This place was very fun and great spot in New York! Great prices for New York for a clean and modern place. It‚Äôs pretty much a high end hostel (especially if you get the smallest room). The room is super small but has everything you need. The view is incredible and the mattress was so comfortable. The pillows could have been firmer. The shower was good too. Overall an excellent decision and I loved it. The area can get a bit sketchy at night so though during the day it was easy to use the subway at night I ended up Ubering back to the hotel. And the location is great but far from a lot of areas.

My only point with the hotel is the staff though very friendly and kind were not always knowing what to do. I asked multiple times if I can pay in cash and was told once I check out it won‚Äôt be a problem. I come to check out and they had already charged my card. I ended up having to wait 20 mins for them to figure it out. That‚Äôs one example of a few things that happened. Obviously won‚Äôt keep me from staying again but it could have been more seamless with a more professional staff.

Otherwise, really enjoyed and will stay again! I love also stayed at Greenwich and I think I liked this one better (though Greenwich was great as well). Definitely recommend!

I stayed here on a short trip I took in February and I could not recommend this place more. The staff was amazing and provided such great service. They were also all super friendly and willing to help. I also loved the convenience of being right on Broadway St. The rooms were the perfect size for me and I loved the view out of the window by my bed. Can't wait to stay here again.

I love visiting lower Manhattan and staying in TriBeCa. This small hotel was a great place to stay and enjoy a night in the heart of it all. Located on a quiet side street, I enjoyed the views of Broadway and Walker Street. The lobby and staff were all friendly and helpful. Gym has fun and unique equipment for a quick workout. Breakfast was excellent at the adjoining restaurant. I would definitely come back to enjoy a stay here.

The location of the hotel is perfect. Nearby are buses and metro. Many galleries.

Negative: tiny rooms, not sustainable. Towels and bed linen changed almost every day. Small portions of shower gel, shampoo, conditioner. A hotel should be sustainable

The regular rooms are comically small.
The employees were great.
The wifi is useless.
Being charged an extra $140 in facilty fees, plus taxes, each day AFTER I left makes me not want to use them again. I was told this was for wifi access, 24 hr gym access & so on, when I called & asked.

We have stayed at hundred if not thousands of hotels all over the world and the staff at this one are THE best.  They are exceptionally helpful, warm, friendly and caring.
The room is a little snug, but the beds are insanely comfortable.  The building is chic and relaxed making it feel like you‚Äôre not stuck in tourist hell.
Will return without doubt.

Sorry New York, we are from LA and we have a lot of space, your micro rooms where the beds literally touch 3 walls freaks me out. You almost bump your face on the back wall as you come in the door. I thought I stepped into another elevator. just kidding, like being in a hall way. if you have another person in the room don't expect a speck of privacy. It was very clean, comfortable bet, hard to climb into. No coffee machine, I called to get one, which a not said to do, left a message, nothing. Next morning got coffee at the little bar, super gross, maybe the almond milk was bad? 2 coffees, undrinkable, 1 good blueberry muffin, 16 dollars. Hmmm...Staff very nice, restaurant for breakfast not open Monday or Tuesday, hmmmm....lame. when you walk into the door you have to go downstairs to check in, up the stairs to go to your room. Hmmm. It's just out of control cramped and crowded, they do the best they can do. Maybe Europeans or little people would be cool with it, put I'm a Jumbo guy who swings his arms around, likes good coffee and a pool and lots of space required, so I'm going to Palm Springs.
I prepaid my room but got double charged. It‚Äôs been a whole week still haven‚Äôt received any response.

So friendly, helpful, professional, warm staff. Very accommodating. Up to date room, sink in room, king bed, spacious modern shower/toilet. Cafe service, beautiful rooftop another club. All secure with W card needed to access areas. Felt safe/secure. Wonderful pm (mod ) validated my overnight stay, thank you. Best visit! Parked at Edison ParkFast.
This review is for the 77 Walker Street Tribeca Location. There are 2 Walker Hotels. Parking is close.

What a special place- I brought some of my grad students this morning for a coffee and the woman at the front desk made sure we were cared for with coffee and water even though the cafe wasn‚Äôt open when we arrived. Her true hospitality took my breath away. The lobby is a gorgeous place to visit but the people are the reason to treasure this place.

I stayed here just for one night, traveling for work. This is one of the cutest hotels I have ever stayed at! The rooms are small but I didn‚Äôt mind it since I was traveling alone. The view from my room was incredible. The coffee shop downstairs was so good. The people were friendly and the coffee was top notch. I loved staying here! Hope to come back soon.
Nice hotel. Room was small but adequate. Hotel employees were very nice.

This hotel is a gem in Tribeca. We booked a large room but I believe the regular rooms are pretty NY standard (#iykyk). Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and stylish. There‚Äôs a cafe, coffee shop, restaurant and speak easy all on site. Would definitely stay here again. Finding space to work in the lobby was hard (it was always busy), but the room has a desk. Highly recommend.

We sat in the lobby and worked after we checked out and the doorman/security assist that was in the lobby that day was so genuine and caring. I watched him interact with customers and he went above and beyond. Hard to find people like that - I hope the hotel pays him well!
Room 705 has no blackout curtains. The light will wake you up when the sunrises. Forget trying to sleep in. Not happy.

We booked a stay for a long holiday weekend on Manhattan and had a really great experience! The rooms are no smaller than we were expecting, and they were cozy and sleek. The bar was really really fun, and the coffee shop on site is excellent. The service was also really excellent -- we rushed our check-in so that we could make it to a dinner reservation and they were so accommodating; stashed our bags quickly and wished us a good dinner. All around the service was kind, prompt, and lovely.

Great hotel in the heart of Tribeca, easy walk to Soho etc. Fantastic staff, special shout out to Mercedes who was a ray of light after a tough journey, made our check-in process smooth and we felt instantly welcome.
Blue bottle coffee right next door, good restaurant for lunch also attached to hotel plus even a speakeasy underneath. What more could you ask for? Rooms are a little small but hey, it‚Äôs Manhattan. I‚Äôll be back

Avoid at all costs! Birthday ruined. Visited end of May - June.

Firstly, the rooms are tiny even for New York. Its a struggle to fit two people in even the largest of rooms with luggage. Hardly any closet space and the bathroom is tricky.

Secondly, the staff at this establishment are despicable, bar one guy, who is Jamaican, who helps with luggage. He was the only friendly and respectful person employed by this hotel and offered suggestions on what to do in the blistering heat, which was more local than the tourist hot spots. The cleaning in our room was not substantial as they found earrings that didn't belong to me and left them on the counter even though they were covered in junk/dust.

Thirdly, which brings me to the most heinous point of all. I had a sentimental plushy which was given to me by my partner when we first met 8 years ago. The cleaners somehow took this from our room, and presumably got caught up with the sheets. When we reported it to the reception they told us we were lying because 'why would a cleaner want that' and said we must have misplaced it because the cleaners said they left it in our room. We were in no way accusing them of theft but explained to this incredibly rude woman on reception that we suspected it was caught up. She denied they had it explicitly and was not helpful. We checked in for the rest of our trip to see if it had shown up but were met with the same attitude. We left our details, so if they did indeed find it, it could be returned to us ASAP as, stated above, it holds extreme sentimental value.

A few days after we left, my partner did in fact receive an email from Mercedes, saying they unsurprisingly had found the plushy. There was no apology, and no time frame stated as to when this needed to be collected. As myself and my partner do not live in the US, we enlisted the help of a friend to collect but they weren't able immediately as were working in LA. My partner called to check a couple of weeks ago about when this could be sent to us as we realized it may take too long only to find that the hotel had thrown it away. We received no communications from them stating that it needed to be collected before x date. They just decided that they would throw something away we specifically had asked them to find. THAT THEY HAD TAKEN FROM US IN THE FIRST PLACE.

This hotel ruined my birthday and has lost something that to me was priceless. I implore people to never stay here as they clearly do not value their customers and are literally some of the worst service staff I have ever encountered.

I was shocked that the rich like this kind of abuse and degradation. We came here as an after party for an art fair. I told the very nice front desk person that the closest I'd ever been to the hotel is to use the bathroom at Blue Bottle in the lobby one time.

We went up to the roof, which has a grand view of the city and hideous decor at the bar. There was a drink list, but I guess you had to ask for a menu. It seemed like the only food anyone could order is a mezze plate where everything appeared to be from Key Foods and served on what I think are those awful disposable bamboo plates.

The drink list was appalling. One red and one white wine. Four or five underwhelming IPAs and a lager. Four sickly house cocktails and three treacly frozen drinks. A liquor menu that resembles the options available on a Jet Blue flight.

Everything was overpriced, but nothing seemed as insultingly expensive as I had guessed. We ordered two simple well drinks, listed at $14. The bartender gave us a bill for $36‚Äîone for $20, the other for $16, which she says is the cost of adding mixers like sugar and lemon juice.

Some companions showed up and left immediately. I wished we'd done the same. We watched an enormous TV flicker through someone's window three blocks away. We looked at the skyline and tried to see my office. We looked at the Renzo Piano Jenga tower and the other famous buildings. Of course we couldn't see our neighborhood in Queens from there, where our local dive objectively surpasses this con job in every metric. Who goes here, I don't know. It's probably the same kind of person who makes a reservation at like a Chili's in Times Square while they're visiting the city to shop at Bergdorf and take selfies at Trump Tower. They're probably getting cancer from bowel insertions of a platinum AmEx and are probably over-leveraged. When I go running in the morning, in an attempt to outlive these cretins, I am in a citywide cloud of smog, caused in part by their Ubers and the Ubers of people like them.

I feel sorry for them, but they also brought this on themselves while they ruin everything for everyone else.

Location was great. Rooms are extremely small. You get a bed, a closet, a sink, and a bathroom. For those of you traveling with a companion, the bathroom door loosely slides closed and doesn‚Äôt latch. There is no fan. You can hear EVERYTHING your traveling companion is doing in there. No refrigerator, no coffee, no iron. The quality of the rooms was mixed. Bedding was very comfortable and the plumbing fixtures were high quality. The shade for the window in the room only operates on an automatic button. Ours did not function upon arrival. Maintenance was able to fix it promptly. Service was polite, but not quite what I was expecting. We ordered champagne when we booked the room and they forgot to deliver it on the first night. When I asked about it the second night, they apologized and sent us up a bottle. However, I was just handed a bottle of warm champagne. Not even a bucket of ice with it. Overall, it was fine, but I‚Äôd consider another property on my next visit to the city.

Every aspect of our stay at this hotel was amazing. The staff was above and beyond accommodating. From making sure we had a room with a view, to great recommendations from the bellman, to the kindness of the housekeeping staff - it was all an amazing experience. The room itself was so comfortable. We loved every aspect of our room. The location is right near the Canal Subway Station, and there is tons of food in the area. I don't think I will be able to stay anywhere else next time we return to NYC! This was just too great, and I can't recommend enough!

I stayed here for a week and it was a great place for a business trip to NYC. Wi-Fi is strong, there‚Äôs a Blue Bottle coffee in the same building (with lots of couches for doing work on), a nice bar at the connected restaurant, and the hotel‚Äôs gym is amazing. Rooms are designed nicely ‚Äî a lot of reviews mention the rooms being small, but I didn‚Äôt feel that traveling solo. If you‚Äôre looking for a room that has a really nice bed / bathroom, a small desk, with a chair, you‚Äôll be happy.

Walker Hotel Tribeca was the perfect home for my 5 day trip to NYC. The room is very chic, and super clean with all amenities & more. The staff is super friendly and always available to help. They have a coffee shop & lunch/dinner spot in the hotel as well as a tucked away speakeasy (Saint Tuesday) - this hotel has it all. It made my stay super easy as I could get a drink, coffee, and a meal all in the same place.

Definitely staying here on my next trip to NYC.

The Walker Hotel is beautifully designed and furnished, affordble, and every single staff member I met were super friendly and helpful. I stayed for work - there's a great space to work and hang out in the lobby. The Blue Bottle cafe was a nice perk. The rooms are very small but it doesn't feel cramped - the trade off is great natural light and a nicely designed boutique room.

The location is super convenient as well and they have a gorgeous rooftop bar and bar on the ground as well. Would highly recommend if space is not a concern for you!

I loved the location amenities the room was small but large bed and big tv. They have a nice coffee shop on the first floor so that was convenient.  The shower spout was in the ceiling. Plenty of hot water. Best shower ever. Very clean. Rooftop bar has amazing views. Only problem was the key stopped working and I had to switch rooms across the hall.

Located near SoHo, Chinatown, and Little Italy. Also a short walk (less than 5 min) to Canal St. Subway Station!
Comfortable bed, luxurious bath products, and even a rainfall shower head! Room ‚Ä¶

Some of their staff - Alicia/Alyssa and Met - are not great quality. The rest have been great, but I won‚Äôt be visiting again after dealing with those two. I was a fan and gave this place five stars after my first stay, not this time. This place barely has heat and of course is pretty small, they can‚Äôt afford awfully behaved receptionists as well.

I had an opportunity to have an evening to myself, away from my husband and daughter, to recharge.  I picked this hotel to get away and it was perfect for the moment.  Visitors should be warned that the rooms are very small with showers only (I love a tub), but they are also absolutely perfect.  The bed was SUPER cozy, the window opened up so I could enjoy some fresh air, and the shower was very nice with the rain feature.  I also liked the location---it is kinda where Tribeca and Chinatown and Little Italy all connect.  The only suggestions:  have on-demand available so I can rent the movie of my choice, and room service should deliver directly to the room instead of to the desk.  I will absolutely return for future "mom away for the night" opportunities.

Front desk any time I stay or call seems overwhelmed. They get flustered when balancing both calls and check in. Johnathen couldn‚Äôt get my email correct after 3 attempts, then asking me to take down their email instead, basically passing me off. He rushed through each of his calls with me. Thank you to Jalen for your great service, getting my email right the first time and my needed information sent to me urgently.

The room is clean, comfortable and gorgeous. However, the back office and customer service was rude and horrible. Called to ask why was the room half made or unmade ok different days and half drank water bottles (not ours) was left in our room on two separate days. I wasn‚Äôt even mad or upset but just wish to understand. Instead the back office or customer service (more like disservice) didn‚Äôt even want to listen and cut me off. So very rude. I felt like I called for assistance but got scolded in return. Seriously horrible people. Avoid this place.

I‚Äôm currently staying in Walker Hotel Tribeca, the hotel has such a cool vibe and great atmosphere in the cafe downstairs!! But I came in here just to say how wonderful and helpful the staff is! JOSEF the manager has been super helpful and kind and NELSON one of the staff members who helped me settle into my new room was so nice and helpful - you can sense their genuine interest in your well being! And that really counts for a first timer in New York. I felt safe and supported and can‚Äôt wait for the rest of my stay :))

Decent, clean comfy bed, small rooms.
Staff ranges from ok to clueless. One staff woman at the checkout kept calling me ‚Äúsweetie‚Äù‚Ä¶ a little too familiar. Another had no idea who was in charge of housekeeping. Baggage handler brought boxes labeled ‚ÄúThis Side Up‚Äù with proper handles UPSIDE DOWN. Location is the reason to be here.

It was my first time visiting New York and I stumbled upon this beautiful boutique hotel online. I stayed here for 4 nights and it was the best decision I made. Disregard the comments about the size of the room. The room is a cozy size, there are compartments for all your luggage/bags, it is tech-savvy, and the beds are extremely comfortable. The staff always made sure my stay was going well and that we had water in the room.

The lobby and main seating area are exceptionally beautiful. They did an amazing job on their interior design. I had the opportunity to speak to a lady who is part of the marketing and interior design team. We had a lovely talk about the design that went into making the hotel. The seating area on the 2nd floor is a great spot to unwind and have a cocktail or coffee during your stay.

Choose this hotel instead of the other chain hotels in NY. The experience and customer service that you will receive here is top notch. Thank you to the staff of Walker Hotel for a superb first visit to NY!

We stayed there for two days of New York City weekend fun. We booked trips to jazz clubs/restaurants/plays. It was a great location.
We got a standard room which was very small but normal for New York City.
There was easy to use TV/electronics which allowed you to cast music and videos.
The service was courteous and efficient.
Good looking basement lobby.
Overall good value.

First time staying and was very impressed. Staff was extremely friendly! I booked with Bell a few hours before arriving and she was absolutely lovely. The space is very well decorated and awesome vibes. Very clean facility rooms are smaller but what more do you need! You won‚Äôt spend much time in the room anyways!

We arrived at the Walker Hotel for the weekend and the check-in was extremely uncomfortable. Once given the key to our room, we opened the door to find an unclean room with towels stacked on the bathroom floor, a dirty shower, no soap, a full garbage and a messy bed. We were celebrating a special occasion and this room was expensive so this was shocking to see. We first called down to the front desk about this situation and no one answered. Then, we went to the front desk and explained the situation. Then, we were given a key to a different room. This next room was much smaller than the original room. So now, we were even more upset. We proceed to go back down to the front desk and explain that the new room was not what we expected or paid for and they said that there was nothing else available and we‚Äôd have to check in later (with no guarantee) for another room. We then asked if they could muster an apology for this situation as we explained that this was very unprofessional of the hotel. To which the front desk responded, ‚Äúit is not unprofessional, it is human error.‚Äù The tone of the front desk and the complete lack of empathy was very unsettling. We ended up staying in the second room as we didn‚Äôt want to deal with the front desk anymore. Aside from this, the rooms (both that we saw) were tiny and the staff are not customer service oriented. We would not come back.

This hotel blew me away! I travel constantly for work and am usually Marriott loyal but this experience made me rethink that. This hotel is perfectly thoughtful to the modern traveler.  It open community area is the ideal environment for working on the go. The rooftop area has one of the best views of NYC. The rooms are small but exquisite, providing everything you need and more. The staff was beyond kind and courteous, even bringing local cookies to the room :) DON'T HESITATE, STAY AT THE WALKER!

Great customer service and really friendly staff. Room is compact but clean and bathroom is neat and nice. Bed is comfortable.

There is no fridge in the room but you can request one at the reception. Or you can tell the staff to save your food in their fridge too.

Love the deco and location of the hotel. Will be going back!!

This has become my go to NYC hotel. I absolutely love it. The rooms are sleek, modern, and NY cozy. The staff is incredible. Every time I stay, they are so welcoming, friendly, and helpful with anything! The lobby and other public spaces are beautifully designed and great to work in or just hang. I also love that street parking has been very easy every time I‚Äôve stayed here! Ohhh and they have a rooftop with amazing city views! üôå  My new favorite thing is the Speakeasy bar with unique and extraordinarily tasty cocktails!

I have stayed at this hotel once before and it was a very pleasant experience. Today I wanted to give a special shout out to Edgar, who was fantastically helpful the other day as I was planning my next stay at the property. He answered the phone when I called with a slew of random questions, and instead of making me feel rushed/silly (which is usually the case when you call a busy front desk), he took my call in another room to ensure he could hear me clearly / was delightfully patient and upbeat throughout our interactions as I asked redundant questions. He really put me at ease throughout our communications in a way that made me feel great about re-booking a stay at this hotel. These are the kinds of experiences that make me want to be a patron somewhere time and time again. So, all that is to say thank you to Edgar for your top notch customer service skills. I hope you get ample recognition for what you are bringing to this establishment.

I booked this trip for work due to proximity, and I loved it. I looked at a lot of reviews and honestly, was not super sure due to various good and below average reviews, but I only had the best experience with the staff, room, cleanliness, etc. The bookings are clear on how big they are - 190SF for the Cortland Corner King I booked. That is small, yes, but it is NYC, and also not too small at all. Again, they tell you this in the booking, so no surprises. The 3 windows in the corner room make it feel bigger too, so I recommend booking a Cortland Corner King room (the description in booking also clarified 3 windows, as opposed to 1). Shower was incredible - hot water and great pressure. I was on the 4th floor (of 10) but the view was still nice of the buildings around me. I am sure a higher floor would be even better. Only comments on the room for improvement is that the outside glass of the windows were filthy, so it blocked some of the view / not good for taking a photo of the window views, and then there is really no place to hang towels by the sink - would be easy to add those to the rooms so there is a place to set wet / drying towels (there is 1 hook in the bathroom right next to the toilet - not an ideal hygienic place to set a hand or face towel). Lastly, no mini fridge for food leftovers, drinks, etc. That is a nice feature when traveling alone and not being able to finish a meal, but wanting to save for later.

The staff was very friendly and I interreacted with at least 5 different people between the desk staff and the bellhops / doormen throughout my stay (no issues - just check in, random questions, and holding my baggage).

Blue Bottle in their lobby is a great amenity. I had coffee there all three days, and worked from there prior to my check in after I landed. Many options for sitting / lounging / working. I was there the last day the rooftop bar (Honey Be?) was open for the season, and this is the only part of the hotel where the staff was not super friendly. The male bartender was great, but there was a female bartender who was simply not enjoying being there and did not care to offer any type of friendly service. No bother, I got two yummy (but overpriced) drinks and beautiful views of the city, so not a huge bummer. Lastly, the small bar below the hotel was incredible - I went 2 nights in a row, and two different bands were playing wonderful live instrumental music (jazz both times). Again, the drinks are pricey, but they also offer beer and wine at a bit lower of a price point if wanting to just hang there and listen to music without spending way too much. open until 2am as well.

Overall, I loved my stay here, and would 10/10 book again in a Cortland Corner King.

The lowest-priced rooms are tiny but well-appointed. The staff is awesome. There is a dude at the front named Jay that helped me out a bunch while I was there this week with directions, getting a table to work at, finding my bags, chit-chatting about NYC, etc, etc. He was awesome. The rooftop was really nice and mellow. I will definitely be back.
Amazing hotel - friendly and professional staff; clean and modern rooms; great vibe throughout the facility. A tremendous value for NYC, and the location can't be beat. Just awesome!

Nice little boutique hotel. The rooms are a little small but nicely updated and clean. The coffee shop on the main floor is clutch for early mornings. They also have a rooftop bar which has an incredible view that I cannot recommend enough. Nice location centrally located. I stay here every time I'm in New York

Absolutely loved this hotel! Great location, conveniently located around train stations. Hotel staff was great, Eric was great and very accommodating. Hotel and rooms overall are pretty clean and beds are comfortable, the rooms are small but cozy and I personally loved the layout I had. Due to COVID, there are certain days for room maintenance so keep that in mind. This is a great stay, the only downside is the staircase when you first enter. I travelled with my baby so it was tiring to have to heave the stroller up and down the stairs but staff was also helpful with that.

Walker hotel is a millennial's dream spot in NYC. The location is great, the hotel is cute and modern and just sexy enough. Staff is accommodating and polite.

The rooms are tiny but that's new york. I have zero complaints about this hotel, it was exactly as advertised and surprisingly charming. Blue Bottle coffee in the lobby is a bonus.

Well decorated and ideally located to explore NYC. But for the rest not a good experience. We knew the room was small but not that small. You can't even go around the bed. But the worst part was the noise, we could hear everything going on in the street making it really difficult to rest. And the room service that knocks on the door 4 times when we left the sign DO NOT DISTURB.

Room is small, but we were out all day and only used it to sleep so it was perfect and everything we needed. The room is nice and fancy. My dog loved the king bed. The staff was not a bother and very accommodating. The hotel is very clean at no point did I wonder if it was clean and was all around comfortable. 10 out of 10 recommend especially with pets. Hotel location could not be better.

Me and my boyfriend stayed there during Christmas holidays. You can see warm
sunset on the whole New York from the window! The hotel is really clean and smells good. Really photogenic too so I took some pics for my insta. The location is really nice. We were just walking to some places from the hotel. Recommend it to stay in New York!
Rooms are on the smaller side but service is always friendly and is very convenient to get around nyc from here
Nice, hip place! Clean with a very interesting gym. I've never used a fast manual treadmill before so it was nice that I was given the chance to try something new.

No good experience. Many broken things at room: safe, store behind the bed, light key‚Ä¶.

Good location, gentle staff good coffe in blue bottle.

Unfortunately I prefered an other hotel for my next trip.

I'd love the location, not a busy street but still very convenient as close to Soho, chinatown, metro station
Doesn't offer breakfast all the time but the lobby is comfy plus a nice underground jazz bar  and a very nice rooftop !enjoy !

Pretty subpar experience at this hotel - seemed to be not well kept and lacked basic essentials (i.e robes). Further the heat was not working, and wasn't fixed for the duration of our stay despite asking. A baseboard heater was sent but would have preferred the AC system to actually work - the technician didn't even try.

Met all my expectations. As a solo traveller the King room was more than enough space. Super comfortable bed, great shower, and nice central location. Would definitely stay again and recommend to friends.

Room is tiny but the bed was super comfortable with a really high quality mattress. The reason for 4 starts is that the window is hardly doing anything in the way of noise filtering making the night very noisy. Every street conversation and everything track cracking on its hinges carries straight to the room. I was on the fourth floor, next time I'll ask for a higher floor and see if that helps

Amazing customer service - from the moment of a friendly staff opening the door for you, to the most graceful, elegant and welcoming front desk manager Edgar (who deserves a separate 5 start review!!) to the cleaning team and the most friendly bartenders and wait stuff. Rooms are tiny but functional, beds are comfy. I‚Äôm totally staying at the walker if I need to stay in NYC.
This was such an amazing stay and highly recommended! We will be back for sure

The hotel was amazing! The room was super cute, pod style. Lobby, restaurant and cafe were awesome. The staff could‚Äôve been nicer though‚Ä¶ I was there for an engagement and they didn‚Äôt seem to care or was welcoming. The Bartender was super super nice tho! Overall, great place, I will recommend!

Seamless check in and out. Service was outstanding from beginning to end. Loved the industrial/art deco design. Room finishings were of high quality. Lobby/ coffee lounge area was so peaceful to hang about. Definitely will stay again!

Nice decor in rooms. Perfect for 1/2 night stay but limited storage/wardrobe space for longer& could be slightly cleaner. No restaurant /bar facilities in the evening but presumably covid 19 is mostly to blame. Presumably the atmosphere in the hotel would otherwise be more vibrant.

Just overall weird vibes for the amount of money you pay. People walking in and out all the time with no security. Lobby is located downstairs. Was trying to work in the lobby (which was very dirty) and they tried to send me to my room. Rooms are very cramped for the high price point.

It was an okay experience. The receptionist who greeted and assisted us during the stay was so friendly.
It's my first time booking a hotel during the pandemic so maybe I'm just not used to people not wearing masks on public areas.
The AC didn't make the room cold enough.
We asked for assistance and not much really happened.
Kinda modernized, but the floors were not given much attention.. Not sure how old the hotel is.
Probably another thing that was covid-affected was their kitchen.
We wanted to try their room service but the menu was limited and needed to be picked up in the lobby.
Overall, the hotel gave us a decent place to stay and that is the purpose of it all.
Thank you Walker Hotel Tribeca.

So be careful when booking, we ended up booking at the wrong Walker hotel. This spot was not terrible as an overall experience but the room was really small. Our room had a queen bed facing a single large window and next to it was 3 feet to the wall. There was a single chair, small desk, the sink for the bathroom and closet. The bathroom was tiny, with a stand up shower. As a 6'2" 240lbs man this room made me feel claustrophobic. It was clean and the staff was decent.

This hotel is fantastic. The design is thoughtful and very nice. The rooms are small. You can even see a floorplan of the rooms on the website. This didn't bother me at all but I want to mention it because it's part of the charm. The rooms have everything you need and again, are thoughtfully designed. The bed was very comfortable and I slept soundlessly every night. I stayed in a Full room and it was great for a solo traveler. The hotel does have Queen and King rooms which have a bit more space for couples. The location of this hotel is exceptional. Right at the end of SoHo, Tribeca, and the LES. I highly recommend staying here.

Cute little place in a great location!
Room was very small even for one person.
No coffee in room but you can buy one at the cafe located on site.
Didn‚Äôt have a chance to check out the rooftop but their speakeasy was great-  live jazz and good drinks

In the middle of lower Manhattan close to everything 12-15 minutes! Close to Chinatown and little Italy...many restaurants to enjoy! In the morning lovely coffee shop and pastries to enjoy and in the evening a beautiful roof top bar to relax and enjoy too!

Super pleased with my stay. I was here for 3 nights in May 2022. The room was immaculate and the bed super comfy. Huge windows with tons of light. Marble bath with rainhead shower. Lavender peppermint bath goodies. Great coffee shop in lobby. Near everything fun to see and do in Tribeca. Great check-in, all staff was helpful and kind.

Don‚Äôs usually post reviews, but feel compelled in this situation. Short trip to NY to visit family @Little Italy. Read review and ratings and chose the Walker. Clean place, but significant issues leading to a very poor experience. Room was not ready to check in until after 5:30 pm. After a day of walking, finding out we could not check in in the afternoon after 3:00 was more than a significant inconvenience. Once we were finally able to check in, we were further disappointed to find the electric blinds did not work and were stuck in the up position. Being a light sleeper, not having blinds - significant problem. Desk clerk offered us sleep masks - seriously. No other rooms available. We will not be return customers.
Rooms were great. All of the guys were super tentative! It has a great location, with two coffee shops in the first floor.

The decor, details, the staff and the vibe everything about this hotel lobby and caf√©. It's  the subtle elegance that keeps me coming back and just lounge with a drink and smile. The staff is always welcoming and friendly, no matter who you are. It¬¥s clean and just feels right.

Very comfortable bed and I couldn't hear any of my neighbors. These are really the two most important parts of any hotel. Definitely wish there was less hair all over the bed when we checked in but overall we had a good experience.

If you end up being locked out of 405 broadway overnight or not electricity or hot water. This hotel is the best. Cheap and cool place to chill. While you wait to figure out what to do with your life. Also a great meeting spot!

Overall had a great stay! Location was perfect with great access to the subway and ease to get around SoHo, Chinatown and lower Manhattan + Brooklyn. The hotel itself was very nice & trendy as were the rooms.

I know people have complained how small the rooms are but honestly for a solo traveler spending little time in the room it was perfect and everything was well thought out! I think much of the problem is people don't understand the size perhaps in comparison to their own rooms/other hotels. On the official Walker Hotel website not only do they give the square footage but they show a room floorplan and photos. I booked on Hotels.com and they did not give as much info so maybe it's third party websites not disclosing as much info that's leading to some surprises when people see the size of the rooms.

One qualm was that the Chromecast did not work. I tried multiple times and separately with my phone and iPad - nothing worked. Additionally, as others had mentioned no mini fridge and water only upon request.
